A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son. LORD, how are they increased that trouble me! many <FI>are<Fi> they that rise up against me.
Many <FI>there be<Fi> which say of my soul, <FI>There is<Fi> no help for him in God. Selah.
But thou, O LORD, <FI>art<Fi> a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.<RF>for: or, about<Rf><CM>
I cried unto the LORD with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.
I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the LORD sustained me.
I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, that have set <FI>themselves<Fi> against me round about.
Arise, O LORD; save me, O my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies <FI>upon<Fi> the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.
Salvation <FI>belongeth<Fi> unto the LORD: thy blessing <FI>is<Fi> upon thy people. Selah.<CM>
